intro: Mosannona xanthochlora, commonly known as the yellow-flowered mosannona, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes plants such as mango and cashew. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glossy leaves and clusters of yellow, catkin-like flowers. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in botany and horticulture.
